00028 void initializeSettingsManager()
00029 {
00030         DEBUG_PRINT("Initialized settings manager\n");
00031         settingsListStart = 0;
00032 
00033         parseConfigFile("./system/root/kernel.config");
00034 }

00040 const char* settingsExecuteLine(const char* Line)
00041 {
00042         DEBUG_PRINT("SETTINGS: EXECUTE %s\n", Line);
00043 
00044 
00045         size_t length = strlen(Line);
00046 
00047         const char* FirstSpace = strchr(Line, ' ');
00048 
00049         if (FirstSpace == 0)
00050         {
00051                 DEBUG_PRINT("SETTINGS: ERROR INVALID COMMAND\n");
00052                 return "FAIL";
00053         }
00054 
00055         const char* SecondSpace = strchr(FirstSpace + 1, ' ');
00056 
00057         if (SecondSpace == 0)
00058         {
00059                 DEBUG_PRINT("SETTINGS: ERROR INVALID COMMAND\n");
00060                 return "FAIL";
00061         }
00062 
00063         const char* End = Line + length;
00064 
00065 
00066         if (*(FirstSpace + 1) != '=')
00067         {
00068                 DEBUG_PRINT("SETTINGS: ERROR INVALID COMMAND\n");
00069                 return "FAIL";
00070         }
00071 
00072         if (FirstSpace - Line == 0)
00073         {
00074                 DEBUG_PRINT("SETTINGS: ERROR INVALID COMMAND\n");
00075                 return "FAIL";
00076         }
00077 
00078         if (End - SecondSpace == 0)
00079         {
00080                 DEBUG_PRINT("SETTINGS: ERROR INVALID COMMAND\n");
00081                 return "FAIL";
00082         }
00083 
00084         char* Name = malloc(length + 2);
00085         memcpy(Name, Line, FirstSpace - Line);
00086         Name[FirstSpace - Line] = '\0';
00087 
00088         DEBUG_PRINT("SETTINGS: *%s*\n", Name);
00089 
00090         
00091         char* Data = malloc(length + 2);
00092         memcpy(Data, SecondSpace + 1, End - SecondSpace - 1);
00093         Data[End - SecondSpace - 1] = '\0';
00094 
00095         DEBUG_PRINT("SETTINGS: *%s*\n", Data);
00096 
00097         settingsEntry* oldEntry = settingsGetEntry(Name);
00098 
00099         if (oldEntry == 0)
00100         {
00101                 //Create a new entry
00102                 settingsCreateEntry(Name, Data);
00103         }
00104         else
00105         {
00106                 //Reuse a old entry
00107                 settingsModifyEntry(oldEntry, Data);
00108         }
00109 
00110         free(Name);
00111         free(Data);
00112 
00113         return "FINE";
00114 }

00120 const char* settingsReadValue(const char* Name)
00121 {
00122         settingsEntry* entry = settingsGetEntry(Name);
00123 
00124         if (entry == 0)
00125         {
00126                 return "";
00127         }
00128         else
00129         {
00130                 return entry->Data;
00131         }
00132 }

00138 void parseConfigFile(const char* Filename)
00139 {
00140         fs_node_t* cfgNode = evaluatePath(Filename, init_vfs());
00141 
00142         if (cfgNode == 0) return;
00143 
00144         char cfgBuffer[1024];
00145         memset(cfgBuffer, 0, 1024);
00146 
00147         size_t length = cfgNode->length;
00148         size_t current = 0;
00149         size_t iter = 0;
00150 
00151 
00152         open_fs(cfgNode);
00153 
00154 
00155         while (1)
00156         {
00157                 if (current >= cfgNode->length)
00158                         break;
00159 
00160                 read_fs(cfgNode, current, 1, cfgBuffer + iter);
00161 
00162                 if (*(cfgBuffer + iter) == '\n')
00163                 {
00164                         *(cfgBuffer + iter) = '\0';
00165                         iter = 0;
00166 
00167                         DEBUG_PRINT("SETTINGS: PARSE LINE %s\n", cfgBuffer);
00168                         settingsExecuteLine(cfgBuffer);
00169 
00170                         memset(cfgBuffer, 0, 1024);
00171                 }
00172                 else
00173                 {
00174                         iter++;
00175                 }
00176         
00177                 current++;
00178         }
00179 
00180         close_fs(cfgNode);
00181 }

00183 settingsEntry* settingsGetEntry(const char* Name)
00184 {
00185         if (settingsListStart != 0)
00186         {
00187                 settingsEntry* iter = settingsListStart;
00188 
00189                 while (iter->next != 0)
00190                 {
00191 
00192                         if (strcmp(Name, iter->Name) == 0)
00193                         {
00194                                 break;
00195                         }
00196 
00197                         iter = iter->next;
00198                 }
00199 
00200                 //Double check
00201                 if (strcmp(Name, iter->Name) != 0)
00202                 {
00203                         return 0;
00204                 }
00205 
00206                 return iter;
00207 
00208         }
00209 
00210         return 0;
00211 }
00212 
00213 settingsEntry* settingsGetLastEntry()
00214 {
00215         if (settingsListStart != 0)
00216         {
00217                 settingsEntry* iter = settingsListStart;
00218 
00219                 while (iter->next != 0)
00220                 {
00221                         iter = iter->next;
00222                 }
00223 
00224                 return iter;
00225 
00226         }
00227 
00228         return 0;
00229 }
00230 
00231 void settingsModifyEntry(settingsEntry* Entry, const char* newData)
00232 {
00233         if (Entry->Data != 0)
00234         {
00235                 free(Entry->Data);
00236         }
00237 
00238         Entry->Data = malloc(strlen(newData) + 1);
00239         strcpy(Entry->Data, newData);
00240 
00241         return;
00242 }
00243 
00244 void settingsCreateEntry(const char* Name, const char* Data)
00245 {
00246 
00247         //Allocate the settings entry
00248         settingsEntry* newEntry = malloc(sizeof(settingsEntry));
00249         memset(newEntry, 0, sizeof(settingsEntry));
00250         
00251         //Allocate memory for the settings entry name and data
00252         newEntry->Name = malloc(strlen(Name) + 1);
00253         newEntry->Data = malloc(strlen(Data) + 1);
00254 
00255         //Copy the name and data
00256         strcpy(newEntry->Name, Name);
00257         strcpy(newEntry->Data, Data);
00258 
00259         //Double check the next entry is pointed to null
00260         newEntry->next = 0;
00261 
00262         //Find the last entry
00263         settingsEntry* last = settingsGetLastEntry();
00264 
00265         if (last != 0)
00266         {
00267                 //Tack this entry on to the end
00268                 last->next = newEntry;
00269         }
00270         else
00271         {
00272                 //Set settingsListStart to this new entry
00273                 settingsListStart = newEntry;
00274         }
00275 
00276         DEBUG_PRINT("SETTINGS: Added new settings entry %s initialized to %s\n", Name, Data);
00277 
00278         return;
00279 }
